    • Content

      /* LightbulbRegressions.do */
/**
 Regression Analysis - Allcott and Taubinsky: The Lightbulb Paradox 
 @author Allcott and Taubinsky
 */


/* SETUP */
* font size for text tables
global statfontsize = "footnotesize"
global DescStatsVars "Factor_Energy UsageMins Age Male _AfricanAmerican _Asian _Caucasian _Hispanic _MiddleEastern"

/* STATEMENTS IN PAPER */
/* Break-offs and Refusals */
use Calculations/iPadData.dta, clear
tab NotComplete // Records of 1561 people approached, with 1087 coupons handed out
tab HowSure // 1102 people began the survey
tab Factor1 // 1089 people gave a Factor1. So basically there appear to be only 2 breakoffs after the first question of the survey. There's no way that this could generate bias.

/* Incandescent and CFL buyers purchase the same number of bulbs per trip */
use Calculations/LightbulbData.dta,clear
** Intend to buy the same number of bulbs
bysort CFL_Purchased: sum NumberofBulbs if PurchasedSubstitute==1
reg NumberofBulbs CFL_Purchased, robust, if PurchasedSubstitute==1

** Actually buy the same number of packages
sum CFL_Units if CFL_Units>0
sum Incandescent_Units if Incandescent_Units>0
reg SalesUnits CFL_Purchased, robust, if PurchasedSubstitute==1


/* DESCRIPTIVE STATISTICS */
use Calculations/LightbulbData.dta,clear



/* Individual correlations */
foreach var in $DescStatsVars {
	*sum `var' if CouponCode!=.
	reg `var' NotComplete, robust // Note: Factor_Energy and Usage Mins are often 0 if NotComplete = 1, but this should be interpreted as missing. Only populate the table with demographic variables if not complete.
	*reg `var' RebateGroup, robust, if CouponCode!=.
	*reg `var' InfoGroup, robust, if CouponCode!=.
}

/* F-Tests */
reg RebateGroup $DescStatsVars, robust, if CouponCode!=.
reg InfoGroup $DescStatsVars, robust, if CouponCode!=.
reg NotComplete Age Male _AfricanAmerican _Asian _Caucasian _Hispanic _MiddleEastern, robust


/* Handing in Coupons */
sum Purchased if CouponCode!=.
reg Purchased RebateGroup, robust, if CouponCode!=.
reg Purchased InfoGroup, robust, if CouponCode!=.


sum PurchasedSubstitute if CouponCode!=.
reg PurchasedSubstitute RebateGroup, robust, if CouponCode!=.
reg PurchasedSubstitute InfoGroup, robust, if CouponCode!=.



/* REGRESSIONS */
outreg, clear
use Calculations/LightbulbData.dta,clear
global XVars = "lnAge Factor_Energy Male _AfricanAmerican _Asian _Caucasian _Hispanic _MiddleEastern _Other"

sum CFL_Purchased

* Removing controls doesn't affect the results
reg CFL_Purchased InfoGroup RebateGroup, robust, if PurchasedSubstitute==1
	outreg, se merge replace varlabels tex fragment starlevels(10 5 1) statfont($statfontsize) summstat(r2 \ N) ///
		keep(InfoGroup RebateGroup)
		
* Thus use the highest-power
reg CFL_Purchased InfoGroup RebateGroup $XVars, robust, if PurchasedSubstitute==1

	outreg, se merge replace varlabels tex fragment starlevels(10 5 1) statfont($statfontsize) summstat(r2 \ N) ///
		keep(InfoGroup RebateGroup)

* But the interaction effect cannot be distinguished
	* Note: The RebateGroup coefficient is not statistically significant when excluding $XVars
reg CFL_Purchased InfoGroup RebateGroup RxIGroup $XVars, robust, if PurchasedSubstitute==1
	outreg, se merge replace varlabels tex fragment starlevels(10 5 1) statfont($statfontsize) summstat(r2 \ N) ///
		keep(InfoGroup RebateGroup RxIGroup)

outreg using "Output/ATEs", replay replace tex fragment statfont($statfontsize)  ///
				ctitles("","(1)","(2)","(3)") ///
				addrows("Individual Characteristics","No","Yes","Yes")

			
** Probit doesn't affect the results
probit CFL_Purchased InfoGroup RebateGroup $XVars, robust, if PurchasedSubstitute==1


** Quantity effects at at subsidized price.
	* Use the coefficient and SE on InfoGroup in this regression
gen IxNoRebateGroup = InfoGroup*(1-RebateGroup)
reg CFL_Purchased InfoGroup RebateGroup IxNoRebateGroup $XVars, robust, if PurchasedSubstitute==1

	
	
************************************************************
************************************************************
/* Estimate the EPM */
use Calculations/LightbulbData.dta,clear
reg CFL_Purchased InfoGroup RebateGroup RxIGroup $XVars, robust, if PurchasedSubstitute==1

local subsidy = 3.16*0.2 // Average subsidy amount for a 60-Watt bulb package
include Code/GetEPM.do



*********************************************************
*********************************************************

/* Bounding information effects */
** Two-sided 90% confidence interval
use Calculations/LightbulbData.dta,clear
reg CFL_Purchased InfoGroup RebateGroup $XVars, robust, if PurchasedSubstitute==1
test InfoGroup = RebateGroup

replace CFL_Purchased = CFL_Purchased-0.02825 if RebateGroup==1


reg CFL_Purchased InfoGroup RebateGroup $XVars, robust, if PurchasedSubstitute==1
test InfoGroup = RebateGroup

* Upper bound of two-sided 90% confidence interval is 73.1% of the actual subsidy effect:
display 0.0770827/.10533


* Upper bound on price equivalent of subsidy = 
display 0.731*0.63


** However, we actually want a one-sided confidence interval in this case.
use Calculations/LightbulbData.dta,clear
reg CFL_Purchased InfoGroup RebateGroup $XVars, robust, if PurchasedSubstitute==1
test InfoGroup = RebateGroup

replace CFL_Purchased = CFL_Purchased-0.04443 if RebateGroup==1


reg CFL_Purchased InfoGroup RebateGroup $XVars, robust, if PurchasedSubstitute==1
test InfoGroup = RebateGroup

* Upper bound of one-sided 90% confidence interval is 57.82%
display (.10533-.04443)/.10533

* Upper bound on price equivalent of subsidy:
display 0.57818285*0.63

* Percent subsidy:
display 20*.5782


************************************************
************************************************



/* ALTERNATIVE SPECIFICATIONS AND ROBUSTNESS CHECKS (NOT IN PAPER) */
use Calculations/LightbulbData.dta,clear
/* Same regressions, within the group of purchasers */
reg CFL_Purchased Factor_Energy, robust, if Purchased==1
reg CFL_Purchased InfoGroup, robust, if Purchased==1
reg CFL_Purchased RebateGroup, robust, if Purchased==1
reg CFL_Purchased InfoGroup RebateGroup Factor_Energy, robust, if Purchased==1
reg CFL_Purchased RebateGroup RebateGroupxFactor_Energy Factor_Energy, robust, if Purchased==1

/* Same regressions, for all coupons handed out */
reg CFL_Purchased Factor_Energy, robust
reg CFL_Purchased InfoGroup, robust
reg CFL_Purchased RebateGroup, robust
reg CFL_Purchased InfoGroup RebateGroup Factor_Energy, robust
reg CFL_Purchased RebateGroup RebateGroupxFactor_Energy Factor_Energy, robust



/* Same regressions, with CFL_Units (number of units purchased) as the outcome */
reg CFL_Units Factor_Energy, robust, if PurchasedSubstitute==1
reg CFL_Units InfoGroup, robust, if PurchasedSubstitute==1
reg CFL_Units RebateGroup, robust, if PurchasedSubstitute==1
reg CFL_Units InfoGroup RebateGroup Factor_Energy, robust, if PurchasedSubstitute==1
reg CFL_Units RebateGroup RebateGroupxFactor_Energy Factor_Energy, robust, if PurchasedSubstitute==1

reg CFL_Units Factor_Energy, robust, if Purchased==1
reg CFL_Units InfoGroup, robust, if Purchased==1
reg CFL_Units RebateGroup, robust, if Purchased==1
reg CFL_Units InfoGroup RebateGroup Factor_Energy, robust, if Purchased==1
reg CFL_Units RebateGroup RebateGroupxFactor_Energy Factor_Energy, robust, if Purchased==1

reg CFL_Units Factor_Energy, robust
reg CFL_Units InfoGroup, robust
reg CFL_Units RebateGroup, robust
reg CFL_Units InfoGroup RebateGroup Factor_Energy, robust
reg CFL_Units RebateGroup RebateGroupxFactor_Energy Factor_Energy, robust
